abstract: New York Yankees pitcher Masahiro Tanaka assures reporters that decrease in velocity of his fastball is intentional.
lead_paragraph: Masahiro Tanaka, who had a mixed outing against the Mets, said he was intentionally throwing more sinkers because he felt his four-seam fastball was hit hard last year. He also indicated that he was trying to relax this spring and not overthrow.

headline.main: Alarmed About Masahiro Tanaka’s Velocity? Slow Down, He Says
headline.print_headline: Alarmed About Tanaka’s Velocity? Slow Down, He Says

snippet: Masahiro Tanaka, who had a mixed outing against the Mets, said he was intentionally throwing more sinkers because he felt his four-seam fastball was hit hard last year. He also indicated that he was trying to relax this spring and not overthrow.
